original: 其記載出於野史小說，傳說乃蜀漢刀匠，曾為諸葛亮西曹掾，於斜谷為諸葛亮鑄刀三千口，俱為神兵利刃。另，木牛流馬或出自其人之手。
text: The record comes from historical novels. The legend is that the swordsmith of the Shu Han Dynasty was once Cao Yue for Zhuge Liang, and he cast 3,000 knives for Zhuge Liang in Xiegu, all of which were sharp swords of the gods. In addition, wooden cows and horses may come from their own hands.
